Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Belgium header: 'On 15 July, all residents of the city of Liège with a population of approximately 200,000 were urged to evacuate amidst fears that the Meuse river was on the verge of bursting its banks and that a dam bridge could collapse.'
Belgium header: 'The town of Verviers was also badly affected and has more than 10,000 of its residents having to be moved because of homes having become uninhabitable.'
Netherlands header: 'After the floodwaters had receded, damage was assessed at €400 million... 2,300 families were affected in the town of Valkenburg aan de Geul.'
Netherlands header: 'More than 10,000 people were evacuated in Venlo and the neighbouring communities Belfeld, Steyl and Arcen on the same evening.'
Germany header: 'On 16 July, 1,300 people had been initially reported as missing.'
Germany header: '4,500 people were preemptively evacuated from parts of Euskirchen following concerns over the Steinbachtal Dam.'
Germany header: 'and later several thousand more people were evacuated from parts of Rheinbach and Swisttal.'
Germany header: 'On 16 July, around 102,000 people were still without power in the regions of North Rhine-Westphalia and Rhineland-Palatinate.'
Germany header: 'while on 19 July the exact number of missing persons remained unclear, a search was ongoing for at least 150 people.'
Luxembourg header: 'In Luxembourg, hundreds of people were evacuated from their homes in Echternach and Rosport.'
Luxembourg header: 'Six people were brought to an emergency shelter in Osweiler cultural centre.'

Locations: Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: United Kingdom header: 'Overnight into 13 July, more than 120 residents of the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea were placed into emergency accommodation due to severe flooding.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: From the 'Belgium' header: 'In the town of Pepinster on the banks of the river Vesder, at least 20 houses collapsed and 23 of the 31 casualties as of 18 July were found here.'
From the 'Belgium' header: 'The town of Verviers was also badly affected and has more than 10,000 of its residents having to be moved because of homes having become uninhabitable.'

From the 'Germany' header: 'Some of the worst damage from the flood was in the district of Ahrweiler, Rhineland-Palatinate, where the river Ahr rose, destroying many buildings and causing at least 110 deaths.'
From the 'Germany' header: 'In Blessem, floodwaters of the Erft river inundated a quarry on 16 July, leading to a major landslide with several buildings collapsed including parts of Burg Blessem.'
From the 'Netherlands' header: '... damage was assessed at €400 million... 2,300 families were affected, 700 homes were rendered uninhabitable, and a bridge had collapsed in Valkenburg aan de Geul.'

From the 'Netherlands' header: 'Heavy rain in the early hours of 25 July caused flooding in the north west of Friesland. In De Westereen, 104.7 millimetres of rain fell. A nursing home was flooded and evacuated.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: From the 'Romania' header: 'In Alba County, rains and storms destroyed three houses and severely damaged another 20 in Ocoliș.'

Total_Summary_Affected.Total_Affected_Annotation: Effects header: 'By the start of June, the drought had affected 35 million people, including 4.2 million facing a drinking water shortage.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Effects header: 'The provinces of Anhui, Gansu, Henan, Hubei, Jiangsu, Shaanxi, Shandong, and Shanxi were impacted by the drought. As well as destroying wheat crops, the drought caused water shortages for an estimated 2.31 million people and 2.57 million livestock.'

Effects header: 'Some lakes, including Lake Hong in Hubei province, dried up significantly, with the Hubei lake shrinking to one-eighth of its normal surface area and one-fifth its usual depth, forcing 3,234 local residents to relocate.'

Effects header: 'On 24 June, 3.65 million people and 3.47 million heads of livestock were short of drinking water in the autonomous regions of Inner Mongolia and Ningxia and the provinces of Gansu and Shanxi despite the flooding in other parts of China.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: about 230,000 homes; about 4,000 homes in need of serious repair; at least 30 houses beyond repair
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: First incident – 'Electricity was cut to about 230,000 homes and about 4,000 homes were left in need of serious repair, and at least 30 houses were beyond repair. Some of the worst hit areas included The Gap, Kenmore, Arana Hills and Albany Creek.' (implicitly linked to the storm that hit on 16 November 2008)

Second incident – 'Torrential rain affected areas of Brisbane, Ipswich and Toowoomba, with rainfall reaching more than 250 mm in some locations. The Ipswich and Marburg areas were the worst affected, whilst four homes in inner-city Paddington were unroofed.' (second storm, 19 November 2008)

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: 20 houses sustaining roof damage; up to 100 more damaged
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Third incident – 'Blackwater, near Emerald in Central Queensland, was hit hard by the third storm, with 20 houses sustaining roof damage and up to 100 more were damaged in some way. Gregory MP Vaughan Johnson said the storm was terrifying. He said he was driving to an appointment when the storm slammed into Blackwater, forcing him to turn back to Emerald. Hail was described as the size of golf balls and witnesses saw a lot of damage.' (third storm, 20 November 2008)

Time_Annotation: Info_Box lists the start date as '10 June 2022 (2022-06-10)' and the end date as '12 September 2022 (2022-09-12)'. Additionally, the header '2022 European heatwaves' mentions that heatwaves affected parts of Europe from June to August 2022.
Administrative_Areas_Annotation: The Info_Box 'Areas' field provides the complete list of affected countries, supplemented by details in the 'By country' and individual country header sections.

Total_Summary_Affected.Total_Affected_Annotation: Neither the Info_Box nor the article provide a single aggregate total number of people affected by Hurricane Agnes; only various state‐ and location‐specific figures are mentioned.

Main_Event_Annotation: The article’s Pennsylvania section states that 'the most significant effects, by far, occurred in Pennsylvania, mostly due to intense flooding' and describes how Agnes 'severely flooded the Susquehanna River and the Lackawanna River', which supports classifying the event as a Flood according to the table.
Hazards_Annotation: Multiple sections – notably the Pennsylvania header – emphasize extreme river flooding (e.g., extensive inundation and destruction along the Susquehanna and Lackawanna Rivers) confirming Flood as the hazard, in line with the Flood hazard listed in the table.
Time_Annotation: Info_Box indicates 'Formed: June 14, 1972' and 'Dissipated: July 6, 1972'. The Meteorological history section also confirms development on June 14 and absorption on July 6.
Administrative_Areas_Annotation: Info_Box 'Areas affected' lists 'Yucatan Peninsula' (with the article noting damage in Mexico), 'Western Cuba', 'East Coast of the United States', 'Atlantic Canada', 'Iceland', and 'British Isles'.

Time_Annotation: Info_Box: 'Formed: December 30, 2002' and 'Dissipated: January 1, 2003'. Also referenced in the Meteorological history section where advisories were discontinued early on January 1, 2003.
Administrative_Areas_Annotation: Info_Box lists 'Areas affected: Mozambique, Malawi' and the Impact and aftermath section details the storm's effects in these countries.

Total_Summary_Affected.Total_Affected_Annotation: No explicit total affected people number is provided in the Info_Box or introductory sections.

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Preparations header: 'In the Gulf of Mexico, non-essential workers at the oil rigs were evacuated, including about 40 employees of Shell Oil Company alone, as oil companies monitored the progress of the cyclone.'
Impact header: 'In Live Oak County near Three Rivers, a tornado crossed a uranium mining business headquarters, extensively damaging a warehouse and an office. A few people received minor injuries.'
Impact header: 'In Karnes County, Kenedy suffered extensive damage after water surged down the Escondido Creek, causing approximately 300 people to evacuate.'
Impact header: 'In Gonzales County, the town of Cheapside observed 18 in (460 mm) of rain in a 24‐hour period... Close to 200 people were rescued from their homes, vehicles, or isolated high spot.'
Impact header: 'The Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County suspended bus service for several hours, stranding approximately 80,000 commuters.'
Impact header: 'In Aldine, over 100 students were required to stay at school until water on the streets could recede.'

Total_Summary_Buildings_Damaged.Total_Buildings_Damaged_Annotation: No aggregate total number of damaged buildings was explicitly mentioned in the Info_Box or any header in the article.

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: destroyed a mobile home, deroofed a fishing lodge
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In Aransas Pass, a waterspout spawned over Redfish Bay moved ashore and destroyed a mobile home, deroofed a fishing lodge, and toppled electrical poles and power lines before lifting.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: damaged a warehouse and an office
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In Live Oak County near Three Rivers, a tornado crossed a uranium mining business headquarters, extensively damaging a warehouse and an office.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: demolished a mobile home, a barn, and unroofed another home
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In a rural area of Bee County, a tornado demolished a mobile homes and a barn, unroofed another home, and downed several electrical poles.'
Impact: 'In LaGrange, a sudden flood wave caused the Colorado River to rise 5.5 ft above flood stage. Some homes in the town received water damage after a creek overflowed.'
Impact: 'In Flatonia, residents evacuated as waters began rising. Eventually, the town became isolated after creeks swelled, while around a dozen homes were flooded.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: 70 homes, 12 mobile homes, and a number of businesses damaged
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In Karnes County, Kenedy suffered extensive damage after water surged down the Escondido Creek, with about 70 homes, 12 mobile homes, and a number of businesses damaged.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: a number of farms in rural areas were flooded
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In Bastrop and Caldwell counties, a number of farms in rural areas were flooded after several creeks and streams overflowed.'
Impact: 'The lower Guadalupe River crested at 42.3 ft at Cuero, and flooding there damaged 40 homes and 4 businesses.'
Impact: 'In Shiner, a flood wave moving down Rock Creek caused severe damage – throughout the town, 118 homes were damaged, with several swept away.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: 150 to 200 dwellings, 75 businesses, and a few local government buildings damaged
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In downtown Hallettsville, at least 15 streets were flooded, resulting in 150 to 200 dwellings, 75 businesses, and a few local government buildings being damaged.'
Impact: 'In Moulton, a total of 18 homes were damaged.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: several dozen businesses and 1,250 homes damaged
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In Harris County, across the region, several dozen businesses and 1,250 homes were damaged.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: dozens of dwellings damaged (including 100 in Texas City) and La Marque City Hall damaged
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In Galveston County, flooding affected several areas; in La Marque and Texas City, dozens of dwellings were damaged—with 100 in Texas City—and the La Marque City Hall was also damaged.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: approximately 30 homes and mobile homes damaged in Gonzales; about 50 homes and mobile homes flooded in Waelder; several dwellings in and around Leesville suffered water damage
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: 'In Gonzales County, water from the rapidly swelling Tinsley Creek damaged approximately 30 homes and mobile homes in Gonzales, about 50 homes and mobile homes in Waelder were flooded, and several other dwellings in and around Leesville suffered water damage.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact header: 'Five people were killed by floodwaters in Shiner. Three teenage boys drowned after a home was washed away and demolished. Two other deaths occurred in the city as a few cars attempted to cross the flooded U.S. Route 77A bridge.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: A tornado in Galveston shattered several windows, damaged some planes, and deroofed a few hangars at the Scholes International Airport; it also severed a major power line, damaged a fire station and a warehouse, and affected several homes and buildings at the Strand Historic District.
Impact: In Fayette County at LaGrange, a sudden flood wave caused the Colorado River to rise, resulting in some homes receiving water damage after a creek overflowed.

Impact: In Brooks County at Falfurrias, the lowest-lying portions were flooded as the Cibolo Creek swelled its bank, causing water to enter homes and businesses.

Impact: In Karnes County, Kenedy suffered extensive damage after water surged down the Escondido Creek, leading to approximately 300 people evacuating and resulting in damage to 70 homes and 12 mobile homes.
Impact: In Lavaca County at Shiner, a flood wave caused severe damage with 118 homes damaged, several of which were swept away.
Impact: In Hallettsville, Lavaca County, heavy flooding inundated downtown—15 streets were hit—with 150 to 200 dwellings, along with businesses and government buildings, suffering damage.
Impact: In Lavaca County at Moulton, a total of 18 homes were damaged.
Impact: In Fort Bend County, over 10 inches of rain led to flooding in low-lying areas south of Katy, where some homes were flooded.

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: several businesses and homes received water damage
Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: In Brazoria County at Angleton, flooding damaged several businesses and homes.
Impact: In Harris County, rainfall led to widespread damage including 1,250 homes, several dozen businesses, and 1,000 vehicles being affected.
Impact: In Galveston County at La Marque, major streets flooded and dozens of dwellings sustained extensive water damage.
Impact: In Galveston County at Texas City, flooding resulted in extensive water damage with 100 dwellings affected.

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Num: approximately 30 homes and mobile homes damaged

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact: In Gonzales County at Waelder, multiple branches of the Baldrige Creek overflowed, flooding about 50 homes and mobile homes.

Total_Summary_Damage.Total_Damage_Annotation: Info_Box: 'Damage: $56.2 million (1981 USD)' and Impact header notes 'Throughout Texas, damage exceeded $56.2 million.'

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: Impact header: 'In Fayette County, 21 in (530 mm) of precipitation was recorded – Preliminary estimates place damage toll in Fayette County at $2.7 million, with $1.5 million for property and $1.2 million incurred to agriculture.'
Impact header: 'In Karnes County, 16.29 in (414 mm) of rain fell... Kenedy suffered extensive damage after water surged down the Escondido Creek, with damage reaching approximately $5 million.'

Impact header: 'In Lavaca County, unofficial reports detailed severe flooding (e.g., in Shiner and Hallettsville) and overall, Lavaca County suffered the worst impact from the storm, with damage reaching approximately $35 million.'

Impact header: 'In Gonzales County, the town of Cheapside observed heavy rainfall; in the city of Gonzales and in Waelder, significant flooding occurred, with damage in the county estimated at over $5 million.'

Main_Event_Annotation: The header 'Tropical Depression Eight (1981)' states that the system 'caused severe flooding in southeastern Texas', which indicates the event falls under the Flood category per the Main_Event–Hazard table.
Hazards_Annotation: Both the header 'Tropical Depression Eight (1981)' and details in the 'Impact' section describe extensive flooding (flash flooding, inundation of streets, homes, and bridges), confirming the hazard as Flood as per the association table.
Time_Annotation: Info_Box states 'Formed: August 26, 1981' and 'Dissipated: August 29, 1981'. The Meteorological history section also confirms these dates, with development beginning on August 26 and degeneration on August 29.
Administrative_Areas_Annotation: The Info_Box lists 'Areas affected: Mexico, Southern United States'. Additionally, the article mentions that the depression made landfall in the Mexican state of Tamaulipas and caused severe flooding in southeastern Texas and affected areas in Louisiana (all within the United States).

Total_Summary_Affected.Total_Affected_Annotation: 2014 Southeast Europe floods header: 'Official counts indicate that over 1.6 million people were affected in Serbia and Bosnia, after a week of flooding.' [14]

Bosnia and Herzegovina section: 'Most of northern Bosnia was flooded, with the Bosna river valley hitting hardest. Other affected areas included the Sarajevo Canton and Tuzla Canton. Northern and northeastern Bosnia, including the region of Semberija, was also flooded.' [26,41,42]
Croatia section: '... evacuation was ordered for Gunja, Rajevo Selo and Račinovci. As of 19 May, around 15,000 people in easternmost parts of Croatia were evacuated from their homes.' [48]
Romania section: 'This was the third major flood to hit Romania... Over 8,000 people were isolated and nearly 2,000 hectares of land were covered by water.' [51]
Slovakia section: 'Floods and strong winds from the cyclone also reached Slovakia, where an elderly man drowned.' [54]

Specific_Instance_Per_Administrative_Are.Annotation: North Carolina and Virginia header: 'On August 27, 1775, a hurricane hit the Outer Banks of North Carolina. It turned northeastward and left the state on September 2, bringing heavy wind and rain to southeastern Virginia. A letter from New Bern, North Carolina, recounted, "We had a violent hurricane...which has done a vast deal of damage here, at the Bar, and at Matamuskeet, near 150 lives being lost at the Bar, and 15 in one neighborhood at Matamuskeet." The September 9, 1775 edition of The Virginia Gazette reported: "The shocking accounts of damage done by the rains last week are numerous: Most of the mill-dams are broke, the corn laid almost level with the ground, and fodder destroyed; many ships and other vessels drove ashore and damaged, at Norfolk, Hampton, and York."'

Newfoundland header: 'A storm struck the eastern coast of Newfoundland on September 9, 1775. It is uncertain if this storm was the remnants of the hurricane that had crossed the Outer Banks over a week earlier. Newfoundland's fisheries "received a very severe stroke from the violence of a storm of wind, which almost swept everything before it," Commodore Governor Robert Duff wrote shortly after it struck. "A considerable number of boats, with their crews, have been totally lost, several vessels wrecked on the shores," he said. Ocean levels rose to heights "scarcely ever known before" and caused great devastation. Losses from the hurricane include two armed schooners of the Royal Navy, which were on the Grand Banks of Newfoundland to enforce Britain's fishing rights.'

Main_Event_Annotation: Header '1775 Newfoundland hurricane' clearly identifies the storm as a hurricane. Since hurricanes are tropical cyclones, this supports assigning the Tropical Storm/Cyclone main event category.
Hazards_Annotation: The 'North Carolina and Virginia' section describes the hurricane bringing heavy wind and rain, while the 'Newfoundland' section mentions a violent storm surge with ocean levels rising dramatically. These details support the hazards of Wind and Flood.
Time_Annotation: Info_Box: 'Formed: August 29, 1775' and 'Dissipated: September 9, 1775'
Administrative_Areas_Annotation: Info_Box lists 'Areas affected: North Carolina, Virginia, Newfoundland'. Additionally, the header '1775 Newfoundland hurricane' notes that the storm struck the Thirteen Colonies and the Colony of Newfoundland, with further details in the 'North Carolina and Virginia' section.

Impact header: 'On January 28, 2021, a voluntary evacuation order was issued in anticipation of a rain storm that posed a threat of mudflows. Heavy rain that night caused mudflows that blocked some roads in Silverado Canyon, rendering them impassible. At least one home was evacuated mandatorily.'

Impact header: 'A second series of mudflows occurred in Silverado Canyon on the morning of March 10, 2021. The mudflows prompted the mandatory evacuations of residents in Silverado, Williams, and Modjeska Canyons, all as a result of their Bond Fire burn scar proximity.'

Impact header: 'On December 14, 2021, a large storm swept through the Southern California area, triggering mudflows in Silverado Canyon for the third time since the Bond Fire. The three communities near the fire burn scar were mandatorily evacuated, but firefighters still had to rescue several residents.'
